introduction: The following passage is adapted from Cosmos by Carl Sagan (1980).
text: Sagan reflects on humanity’s quest to understand the universe, highlighting the role of scientific discovery in revealing cosmic mysteries. The development of radio telescopes ______ astronomers to detect signals from distant galaxies, expanding our knowledge of the universe’s vastness.
question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English? Pay close attention to verb tense consistency, subject-verb agreement, and how the verb aligns with the historical and scientific context of the passage.
explanation: Choice A is the best answer. The present perfect has allowed effectively connects the historical development of radio telescopes with their ongoing contributions to modern astronomy, emphasizing their lasting importance. Choice B is incorrect because allowed confines the action to the past, failing to highlight its continuing significance. Choice C is incorrect because allowing does not form a complete verb, leaving the sentence incomplete. Choice D is incorrect because allows incorrectly implies the action is happening currently, disrupting the historical focus.
